metadata.source: Curated from official program websites and VA resources
metadata.description: Mental health resources for veterans including crisis lines, therapy providers, peer support groups, and community programs

resources.description: The Veterans Crisis Line connects veterans and service members in crisis with qualified, caring responders. Available 24/7, 365 days a year. Calls are free and confidential. Responders are specially trained to help veterans.

eligibility.summary: All veterans, service members (including National Guard and Reserve), and their families - even if not enrolled in VA health care

resources.how_to_access: Call 988 and press 1, text 838255, or chat online at VeteransCrisisLine.net. No registration required.
resources.response_time: Calls answered in less than 9 seconds on average

resources.description: Vet Centers provide free, confidential counseling for PTSD, military sexual trauma, and readjustment challenges in a relaxed, non-medical community setting. Services include individual, group, marriage and family counseling.
resources.hours: Flexible hours including evenings and weekends
resources.location_notes: 300+ Vet Centers nationwide plus 83 Mobile Vet Centers

eligibility.summary: Combat veterans, veterans who experienced MST, veterans who provided mortuary services or direct emergent medical care, UAV crew members supporting combat operations, and their families

resources.privacy_note: Vet Center records cannot be accessed by other VA offices, DoD, or military units without permission
resources.how_to_access: Call 1-877-927-8387 or visit vetcenter.va.gov to find your nearest Vet Center. Walk-ins welcome.

resources.program_name: Steven A. Cohen Military Family Clinics
resources.description: Network of 22 mental health clinics across 21 states providing specialized, evidence-based treatment for PTSD, anxiety, depression, and relationship issues. Offers individual, couples, and family therapy with telehealth options.
resources.hours: Varies by clinic; flexible scheduling available
resources.cost_notes: Services provided at low or no cost based on ability to pay
resources.location_notes: 22 clinics in 21 states; expanding to 5 clinics in Asia (Japan/South Korea) for military families abroad

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 veterans (including National Guard and Reserve) and military family members

resources.how_to_access: Visit cohenveteransnetwork.org to find a clinic near you or request a telehealth appointment.
resources.impact: Over 93,000 clients treated; 845,000+ clinical sessions since 2016

resources.description: Give an Hour connects veterans and military families with volunteer licensed mental health professionals who provide free, confidential counseling. Services address anxiety, depression, PTSD, substance abuse, grief, and other mental health concerns.

eligibility.summary: Active-duty military, reservists, National Guard, veterans, and in certain cases spouses and caregivers

resources.how_to_access: Search the provider directory at giveanhour.org to find a local volunteer mental health professional. Schedule directly with the provider.

resources.description: Confidential, barrier-free, stigma-free PTSD treatment for veterans, service members, and family members. Provides evidence-based therapies including CPT, EMDR, and Prolonged Exposure. 30 free sessions per trauma type with quick matching to expert clinicians.
resources.cost_notes: 30 cost-free sessions per trauma type; extended therapy available with client copay
resources.location_notes: In-person in 15 states plus D.C.; nationwide via telehealth

eligibility.summary: Veterans of all eras regardless of discharge status, service members, and family members connected to their care

resources.how_to_access: Fill out a simple form at theheadstrongproject.org. Hear back within 2 business days. First session within 2 weeks.
resources.response_time: Contact within 2 business days; first session within 2 weeks
resources.impact: 44,000+ free sessions provided in 2024; 97% client return rate; 89% report treatment was effective

resources.description: A 12-week mental health program using adventure-based learning to help veterans manage PTSD, anxiety, and depression. Includes a 5-day retreat with cohort-based activities. Programs available for individuals, couples, families, and gender-specific groups.

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 veterans and service members who incurred a physical or mental injury, illness, or wound while serving. Family members and caregivers may also be eligible.

resources.how_to_access: Contact WWP Resource Center at 888-997-2586 or resourcecenter@woundedwarriorproject.org to enroll.

resources.description: An accelerated 2-week intensive outpatient brain health program at four world-renowned academic medical centers. Provides 50+ hours of treatment for PTSD, TBI, MST, and other mental health issues using a cohort model. WWP covers 100% of treatment, travel, meals, and expenses.
resources.cost_notes: WWP covers 100% of treatment, travel, meals, and related expenses

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 veterans and service members dealing with PTSD, TBI, MST, or other mental health conditions

resources.how_to_access: Contact WWP Resource Center at 888-997-2586 to apply. Clinical assessment determines program placement.
resources.impact: 68,600+ hours of PTSD and TBI treatment provided

resources.description: A non-clinical goal-setting program connecting veterans, spouses, and family members with a dedicated, empathetic listener through weekly phone calls. Helps plan individualized paths toward personal growth.

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 wounded veterans, their spouses, and family members

resources.how_to_access: Contact WWP Resource Center at 888-997-2586 to enroll in the program.
resources.impact: Nearly 13,000 emotional support calls provided to warriors and families

resources.description: Community of veterans, service members, military families, and supporters united through physical activity and social connection. Local chapters host weekly fitness activities (running, hiking, yoga, functional fitness) and monthly social events to combat isolation and build camaraderie.

eligibility.summary: Open to all veterans regardless of age, service members, military families, and community supporters

resources.how_to_access: Download the Team RWB Member App or visit teamrwb.org to find local events. FREE to join.

resources.description: Leadership development program that empowers veterans to lead community chapters and events. Develops skills in event planning, team building, and community engagement while providing purpose and connection.

eligibility.summary: Team RWB members interested in leadership roles

resources.how_to_access: Join Team RWB and apply for leadership opportunities through the organization.

resources.org_name: Travis Manion Foundation (formerly The Mission Continues)
resources.description: Veteran-led service platoons in 40+ cities where veterans and community members volunteer together on local projects. Activities include building community gardens, painting school murals, supporting food banks, and neighborhood revitalization. Provides purpose, camaraderie, and community connection.

eligibility.summary: Open to all - veterans, service members, military families, and community members who want to serve

resources.how_to_access: Visit missioncontinues.org to find a platoon in your city and sign up for upcoming service projects.
resources.impact: Note: In 2025, Travis Manion Foundation acquired The Mission Continues, uniting both organizations

resources.description: Comprehensive mental health services through VA medical centers including individual therapy, group therapy, medication management, and specialized programs for PTSD, substance use, and more. First three outpatient visits per year are copay-free through 2027.
resources.cost_notes: First 3 outpatient mental health visits per year are copay-free through 2027

eligibility.summary: Veterans enrolled in VA health care

resources.how_to_access: Enroll in VA health care at va.gov/health-care/apply. Contact your local VA medical center to schedule mental health appointments.

resources.description: Specialized PTSD treatment at VA facilities including evidence-based therapies (CPT, PE, EMDR), residential treatment programs, and clinical trials. PTSD specialists available at every VA medical center.
resources.cost_notes: First 3 outpatient visits per year are copay-free through 2027

eligibility.summary: Veterans enrolled in VA health care with PTSD diagnosis or symptoms

resources.how_to_access: Talk to your VA primary care provider or mental health provider about PTSD treatment options. Call 1-800-698-2411 for help.

resources.description: One-on-one case management and mental health support for combat wounded, critically ill, and catastrophically injured service members and veterans. Provides lifetime support including therapy funding, treatment navigation, and family support.
resources.hours: Case manager assigned for ongoing support

eligibility.summary: Combat wounded, critically ill, and catastrophically injured service members and veterans from all branches
eligibility.disability_notes: Must be combat wounded, critically ill, or catastrophically injured

resources.how_to_access: Apply through thefund.org website. Case managers provide personalized support throughout recovery.
resources.impact: $500+ million in grants and services since 2004; served nearly 16,000 individuals in FY2025

resources.description: Free mental health services focused on suicide prevention for veterans and service members. Provides personalized care plans, therapy referrals, and ongoing support from dedicated care coordinators.
resources.hours: Business hours with 24/7 crisis support via VCL

eligibility.summary: Service members, veterans, and military family members at risk of suicide or struggling with mental health

resources.how_to_access: Call 1-844-889-5610 or visit stopsoldiersuicide.org to connect with a care coordinator.

resources.description: Progressive and Alternative Training for Healing Heroes (PATHH) is a free 7-day residential program using Posttraumatic Growth principles to help veterans transform struggle into strength. Combines clinical support with outdoor activities and peer connection.
resources.location_notes: Retreat centers in Virginia and Arizona

eligibility.summary: Combat veterans and first responders struggling with PTSD, anxiety, depression, or transition challenges

resources.how_to_access: Apply through bouldercrest.org for a Warrior PATHH cohort.

resources.description: Free online courses for veterans, families, and providers about military culture, PTSD, suicide prevention, and navigating mental health resources. Helps veterans understand their challenges and find appropriate support.

eligibility.summary: Anyone - veterans, family members, providers, and community members

resources.how_to_access: Create a free account at psycharmor.org and access courses immediately.

resources.description: Comprehensive mental health treatment at UCLA for post-9/11 veterans with PTSD and TBI. Provides intensive outpatient treatment, medical care coordination, and family support. All services including travel and lodging are provided at no cost.
resources.cost_notes: All treatment, travel, and lodging provided at no cost
resources.location_notes: UCLA Medical Center, Los Angeles, CA

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 veterans with PTSD and/or TBI

resources.how_to_access: Apply through uclahealth.org/operation-mend. Program covers all expenses including travel.

resources.description: Partnership between Massachusetts General Hospital and Red Sox Foundation providing free mental health care to post-9/11 veterans and families. Offers 2-week intensive clinical program, outpatient services, and family support. No VA referral or enrollment required.

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 veterans, National Guard, Reserve, and military families

resources.how_to_access: Call Home Base or apply online at homebase.org. No VA referral required.

resources.description: Free, confidential, short-term counseling for active duty, National Guard, Reserve, and recently separated veterans (within 365 days). Up to 12 sessions per issue covering stress, relationships, grief, and life transitions. Available in-person, by phone, or online.

eligibility.summary: Active duty, National Guard, Reserve, and veterans within 365 days of separation. Also available to family members.
eligibility.separation_limit: Within 365 days of separation for veterans

resources.how_to_access: Call 1-800-342-9647 or visit militaryonesource.mil to request counseling.

resources.description: National Alliance on Mental Illness offers free peer support groups, family education programs, and a helpline for veterans and families affected by mental health conditions. NAMI Homefront teaches families about military culture and mental health.

eligibility.summary: Veterans, service members, and family members affected by mental health conditions

resources.how_to_access: Call 1-800-950-NAMI, text 'HelpLine' to 62640, or visit nami.org to find local programs.

resources.description: Community-based mental health services for veterans including counseling, substance abuse treatment, and support for homeless veterans. Programs vary by location but focus on holistic support combining housing, employment, and mental health care.

eligibility.summary: Veterans, with priority for homeless or at-risk veterans

resources.how_to_access: Call 1-800-899-0089 or visit voa.org/veterans to find local programs.
